titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the President should suspend the proposed sale of the Army Tactical Missile System to the Government of Turkey until that Government improves its human rights record and terminates its embargo of Armenia and progress is made to resolve the conflict on Cyprus.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 12/21/1995--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should suspend the proposed sale of the Army Tactical Missile System to the Government of Turkey until: (1) such Government improves its human rights record and terminates its embargo of Armenia; and (2) progress is made to resolve the conflict on Cyprus.
